passage.title: You must stick the stamp on yourself
passage.paragraph: Once a Frenchman lives in England. He does not know English very well. One day he goes to the post office with a letter. He buys a stamp. He gives the stamp, together with his letter, to the girl at the desk.
"Oh, no," the girl says, "you must stick the stamp on yourself."
He is very much surprised. He does not believe his ears. "Why must I stick the stamp on myself?" he asks.
"Oh," says the girl. "I mean that you must stick the stamp on the letter; you must do it yourself."
